verses.roman:
vivasvataś ca dve jāye
viśvakarma-sute ubhe
saṁjñā chāyā ca rājendra
ye prāg abhihite tava

synonyms: vivasvataḥ—of Vivasvān; ca—also; dve—two; jāye—wives; viśvakarma-sute—the two daughters of Viśvakarmā; ubhe—both of them; saṁjñā—Saṁjñā; chāyā—Chāyā; ca—and; rāja-indra—O King; ye—both of whom; prāk—before; abhihite—described; tava—unto you.
translation: O King, I have previously described [in the Sixth Canto] the two daughters of Viśvakarmā, named Saṁjñā and Chāyā, who were the first two wives of Vivasvān.
